title: The True Cost of Textile Waste
description: Learn The True Cost of Textile Waste in one minute.

hook.text: The average person throws away 70 pounds of clothing per year. Less than 15% of donated clothes actually get worn again.

buildup.text: Synthetic fabrics like polyester and nylon take 200+ years to decompose, leaking microplastics into groundwater.

discovery.text: Fashion produces 10% of global carbon emissionsâ€”more than aviation and shipping combined. Manufacturing drives most.

twist.text: Clothing labeled 'recyclable' rarely is. Blended fabrics can't be separated economicallyâ€”they're downcycled or burned.

climax.text: Wearing each garment 30% longer (just 9 extra months) would cut its carbon, water, and waste footprint by 20-30%.

punchline.text: The most sustainable garment is the one you already own.

quiz.question: How much of global carbon emissions does the fashion industry produce?
options: About 10%, more than aviation and shipping combined
